title: What is Quantum Psychology and how does it relate to Advaita Vedanta and Nisargadatta Maharaj?
first_phrase: This section is an ode to the spiritual teachers who have influenced the author's life and work, particularly the grandfather of Quantum Psychology, Sri Nisargadatta Maharaj. The text includes references to Bagawan Nityananda and Shirdi Sai Baba, as well as the Buddha, all of whom played a role in shaping the author's understanding of Advaita Vedanta, which asserts that there is only one substance, and that everything else should be discarded or questioned. The summary of Maharaj's teachings outlines the importance of letting go of the ego and embracing the I AM.
content: To the Buddha, and the disappearance of the "I". ________________ uantum Psychology is an extension and continuation of Q., Nisargadatta Maharaj—i.e., Advaita Vedanta—and it has several premises which form its basic core: AdvaitaVedanta There is only THAT ONE SUBSTANCENeti-Neti not two or more substances(Sanskrit for Not This-Not This) SUMMARY OF NISARGADATTA MAHARAJ 1 There is only ONE SUBSTANCE. 2. The experiences is contained within the experience itself. 7. Anything you think you are—you are NOT. 8. Hold onto the I AM, let go of everything else. 9. Anything you know about you cannot be.
last_phrase: In conclusion, Quantum Psychology's core principles are based on Advaita Vedanta and the teachings of Nisargadatta Maharaj, emphasizing the existence of ONE SUBSTANCE and the need to discard false notions of self. By realizing ESSENCE, one can experience essential qualities like love, peace, and joy, leading to multi-dimensional awareness and a greater understanding of the self.
